column4: Hi, How can I access a local IP adres through extranet ? (or is this impossible) (Goal = print through vpn connetion, via browser)
you need to portforward throught eh firewall

you say you want to print there from the extranet that means either you need to enable the source's ip adress on the printer that you are trying to print to or if behind a firewall you need to portforward to the printer
that makes me think, I can ping to the printer.. so I could edit the printer to allow my adress to print directly on it ?
basically thats the wway you do it
could I bypass the spooler this way ?
why would you want that? and nope, only if you got a print server and bypass that one
because I do not get access to this printer through "unsafe" ubuntu
as in I am not allowed to use the local network
in that case youre doomed id say
if your printers are browsable you can search for them in ubuntu and just use them, i seriously doubt that your it will notice that you printed from linux not windows
that is how I did it till now
well you need to be able to connect to where the vpn terminates everything else is business as usual
